channel.title: Code on Gremlin Mysteries
channel.description: Recent content in Code on Gremlin Mysteries

item.title: Ascii
item.description: Because sometimes quotes are a pain \x27 == ' \x22 == " https://www.asciitable.com/

item.title: AsciiDoc
item.description: Resources Start Here: https://themes.asciidoctor.org/preview/ # Starter explaination https://espadrine.github.io/AsciiDocBox/ # For Testing http://asciidoc.org/ # Main grit

item.title: AWK
item.description: Print Nth item in row hostname -i | awk ‘{print $1}’ Pull info out of quotes echo “<a href=“www.duckduckgo.com”>” | awk -F ‘"’ ‘{print $1}’

item.title: C Programming Language
item.description: Compiling Generate a configure file autoconf configure.ac Makefile exists? ./configure User basics: make && make install Resources https://suchprogramming.com/new-linux-process-c/ (fork() new processes)

item.title: Cython (Python/C)
item.description: => apt-get mingw-w64 (Windows) => x86_64-w64-mingw32-gcc -o main64.exe main.cx => cython –embed python.py -o python.c => gcc -I /usr/include/python$(version) python.c -lpython$(version) -o python(.exe)

item.title: Find Command
item.description: Print subdirs or files in a dir cd $targetdir && find . -maxdepth 1 -mindepth 1 -type d -printf “%f”

item.title: Git Pro > notes (book)
item.description: Print tags => git tag Extended info => git show v1.4 Adding tags to older commits (parse first) => git log –pretty=oneline example output: 9fceb02… updated rakefile Append the tag to commit => git tag -a v1.2 9fceb02 Sharing tags => git push origin v1.5 All the tags all at once => git push origin –tags Even more info => git checkout 2.0.0 Read PG. 59 if needed…

item.title: Github Quick Reference
item.description: Push to origin git add . # or file_name.sh to each new addition git commit -m __“commit message” git pull git push -u origin

item.title: Grep Command
item.description: Note * Astrisks are escaped because markdown Match or match grep ‘match|match2’ grep -E ‘match|match2’ Match and match grep ‘match.*match2’ Omit match grep -v ‘match’ Beginning/end of line match grep “^match” grep “match$”

item.title: Markdown Language
item.description: Convert Markdown to PDF flatpak install org.freedesktop.Sdk flatpak install flathub io.atom.Atom Edit > Preferences > Install > Markdown to PDF Packages > Markdown to PDF > Convert

item.title: Perl Programming Language
item.description: Print Nth instance of match perl -lne ‘print $1 if /Today:(.*)/’ < downloaded_webpage.txt

item.title: Python Package Index
item.description: Installing a Python Package pip3 install “project” pip3 install “project==5.7.1” pip3 install “project>=5.6.1” Upgrading packages pip3 install –upgrade “project”

item.title: Sed Command
item.description: Note: * are escaped because markdown.. Wrap every line output in quotes sed ’s/"(.*)/"\1"/g' Remove Whitespace Lines sed ‘/^$/d’ Remove everything before match sed ’s/."*match//' Remove everything after match sed ’s/match."*//g' Replace first instance of match sed ‘0,/example1/{s/example1/example2/}’ Replace Nth instance of match sed ’s/example1/example2/2g 2g == 2nd match Print Nth Line sed -n ‘7p’ # 7th line sed ‘7!d’ # Also 7th line Replace newline chracter w/space Tip: don’t use sed… tr ‘"\n’ ’ ’ < input_filename Remove brackets and everything inside brackets sed -e ’s/"[[^][]"*]//g’ Resources https://linuxhint.

item.title: ShellCheck
item.description: Basic Commands shellcheck /dir/script.sh Notes Contents of _EOF_ might indicate miss-redirect [»]
